data.title: Pineapple Express premiere in LA
data.text:
Spider-Man actor James Franco at the LA premiere of Pineapple Express with girlfriend Ahna O'Reilly. Franco plays a dealer who's selling a new type of strong cannabis called Pineapple Express.

Seth Rogen, with girlfriend Lauren Miller, plays cannabis smoker Dale Denton. He's on his way to see his dealer Saul Silver (James Franco) when he witnesses a murder carried out by a crooked cop.

White Men Can't Jump actress Rosie Perez with Danny McBride on the red carpet. Perez plays the crooked policewoman who carries out the murder witnessed by stoner Dale Denton. McBride plays Red.

Californication actress Amber Heard plays Angie Anderson in Pineapple Express. Main characters Dale Denton (Seth Rogen) and Saul Silver (James Franco) are forced to flee the city after Dale drops a spliff.

Jim Carey and girlfriend Jenny McCarthy dress down at the Mann Village Theatre premiere in LA. The film continues with officer Carol Brazier (Rosie Perez) trying to track down Dale and Saul.

Kanye West, wearing a bright, blue jacket and sunglasses, was there to see the film. It was written by Seth Rogen, who also stars in the movie and wrote 2007 comedy Superbad with friend Evan Goldberg.

Clueless actress Alicia Silverstone gets her hair straight for photographers on the red carpet. The 31-year-old is working on a new TV series called Bad Mother's Handbook.

Bond actor Daniel Craig is in Los Angeles with partner Satsuki Mitchell. The film originally had a $40m (£20m) budget but writer Seth Rogen says that was cut to $25m (£12.5m).

Girl Next Door actor Emile Hirsch waves at the crowd. According to Pineapple Express producer, Judd Apatow, inspiration for the film came from Brad Pitt's character Floyd in True Romance.

Coach Carter actor Channing Tatum also turns up at the premiere. A trailer for Pineapple Express was put on the Superbad DVD. The soundtrack includes songs from Cypress Hill and Public Enemy.
